message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.DS, cs.OS, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the design of a Transaction Certification Service (TCS) for modern data stores, which is a core component of distributed systems. The paper presents atomic commit protocols that require only f+1 replicas and reconfigure the system upon failures using an external reconfiguration service. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with data stores and transaction processing, which are topics that fall under the Databases (cs.DB) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA), which is a networking technology that falls under the Operating Systems (cs.OS) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with fault-tolerance and correctness, which are topics that fall under the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category.
